alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Greater Oconee; Greater Pickens; Oconee Mountains (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 8:13AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Franklin, southeastern Stephens, Hart, northwestern Anderson, southwestern Pickens and southeastern Oconee Counties through 845 AM EDT... At 813 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles north of Clemson to 12 miles east of Toccoa to 4 miles south of Carnesville. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clemson, Seneca, Hartwell, Walhalla, Carnesville, Central, Pendleton, Royston, Westminster and Reed Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Anderson; Greater Oconee; Greater Pickens; Oconee Mountains
